text: Agriculture and biodiversity this is a highly important subject when man stop traveling 12,000 years ago and started having many babies invented Agriculture and breeding and this disrupted the ecosystem there could be um human beings without agriculture but there can be no humankind without agriculture man needed to feed the population and uh in the fields in the 19th century man stopped mixing wild plants and cultivated plants in the fields then everything changed uh irrigation was invented plants were selected genetic work started in sensive aromy with high levels of pesticides insecticides many babies were born and the human population is multiplied by three between 1950 and today and the agriculture had to keep pace and what we thought was the ideal situation started being challenged in the 70s and 80s the dark clouds started accumulating over humankind best icid insecticides soil pollution destruction of pollinator insects pollinator insects are absolutely vital because except for a few plants such as cereals uh many plants are pollinated fruit and flowers and if we lost them the loss would be 180 billion a year to pay the women who would have to uh replace bees and pollinate plants manually so this is the challenge we can't increase uh arable surface we have to stop wasting water and uh we have to uh try to suppress pesticides uh decrease the use of fertiliz fertilizers used biodiversity to maintain uh Manpower in agriculture not too much mechanization we have to allow Farmers to work and be proud of their job because uh the fact that we lose agriculture in the mountains is also a sign of loss of biodiversity and when we talk about biodiversity I'll give you a case there was uh rice dwarfing a viral epidemic in 2007 and obviously this had an impact on millions of people in the local population it was necessary to test 6,300 varieties of rice to find one lost in a Himalayan Valley that resisted the virus now nowadays this species is cultivated over 100,000 square kilometers in Asia this is biodiversity um at it best bringing a response a reply to a problem and a lost Himalayan Valley rice species allowed to solve the problem so we need to PR bi preserve biodiversity in plants and animals we need to control the animal population there are far too many cows on Earth 1.5 billion cows far too many we need to respect nature we need to create agroecology intensively and also organic growing but we can't grow plants organically everywhere we simply want to make sure that we need to feed seven and very soon 9 billion human beings on Earth providing uh protein and also uh Distributing uh the resources better across the world this is a huge challenge Agriculture and biodiversity
